New Records: Freddie Freeman tied a World Series record with 12 runs batted in.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers capitalized on a series of errors and misplays by the Yankees to win 7-6.
Freddie Freeman drove in the tying runs in a five-run rally in the fifth inning.
Mookie Betts brought in the winning run with a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning.
Walker Buehler finished off the Yankees with his first career save, fanning Alex Verdugo for the final out.
Gavin Lux worked a full count before lofting a game-tying sacrifice fly to center.
Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly that put the Dodgers ahead for good, 7-6.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the second time in postseason history that a team blew a five-plus run lead with all of the runs being unearned. The previous time came in the 1956 World Series when the Yankees blew a five-run lead against the Brooklyn Dodgers in Game 2.
